alert.note: Alert for Catalina and Santa Barbara Islands; Los Angeles County Beaches; Malibu Coast (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Coastal Flood Advisory issued January 19 at 8:39PM PST until January 20 at 10:00AM PST by NWS Oxnard
info.description: ...COASTAL FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM PST SATURDAY... ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 3 AM SATURDAY TO 10 PM PST SUNDAY... * WHAT...For the Coastal Flood Advisory, minor coastal flooding expected. For the High Surf Advisory, large breaking waves of 5 to 7 feet with dangerous rip currents. * WHERE...Catalina and Santa Barbara Islands, Malibu Coast and Los Angeles County Beaches. * WHEN...For the Coastal Flood Advisory, until 10 AM PST Saturday. For the High Surf Advisory, from 3 AM Saturday to 10 PM PST Sunday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding of sea water is possible around the time of high tide, over vulnerable low-lying coastal areas such as parking lots, beaches, and walkways. Significant damage to roads or structures is NOT expected. There is an increased risk for ocean drowning. Rip currents can pull swimmers and surfers out to sea. Large breaking waves can cause injury, wash people off beaches and rocks, and capsize small boats near shore. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...High tides near 6.0 feet are expected at around 600 AM Sunday.
info.instruction: Take the necessary actions to protect flood-prone property. Do NOT drive around barricades or through water of unknown depth. Remain out of the water due to dangerous surf conditions, or stay near occupied lifeguard towers. Rock jetties can be deadly in such conditions, stay off the rocks.

area.areaDesc: Catalina and Santa Barbara Islands; Los Angeles County Beaches; Malibu Coast
